title: Canon on Cannon: Decoding the Coordination Puzzle in DeSci
subtitle: Imagine a cannon. The explosive force propelling a cannonball is immense. Yet, without a barrel guiding its path, that formidable blast could easily dissipate aimlessly. This analogy doesn't just apply to cannons but perfectly encapsulates the current wave in the scientific realm - decentralized science (DeSci).
content:
The recent buzz around LK-99 has been hard to miss. The astounding discovery of room-temperature superconductors from everyday materials sent ripples across the online scientific community. In a domain where renowned figures often claim landmark discoveries, two Korean scientists, quietly laboring for two decades, managed to upend long-standing beliefs in material science, attracting immediate acclaim.

In a time where major names often make headlines, this was indeed a fresh perspective. Enthusiasts and premier research institutions alike jumped into the fray. My curiosity led me to a Telegram group centered on this discovery. Initial enthusiasm in August soon gave way to wider discussions in X Spaces and collaborative research proposals. Yet, a hush descended on the group in just a fortnight. While a few solo endeavors continue on platforms like Obsidian and GitHub, the anticipated group synergy appears to have slowed.

In the world of DeSci, smooth coordination is of the essence. It's vital that every contributor remains in sync, channeling their energies purposefully and avoiding overlap. Just as crucial is the equitable allocation of value. When individuals sense that their contributions are justly valued and rewarded, what were once mere side projects evolve into game-changing ventures. For DeSci to stand toe-to-toe with traditional science (TradSci), it requires not just talent and funding, but robust organizations to channel those towards desired outcomes.

Drawing from my stint in innovation and product development, and after engaging with several notable DeSci entities, here are some insights into their coordination needs:

1 - Organizational Structure & Efficiency:

  1. Structures that can both grow and stay effective.
  2. Flexibility to adjust and evolve with shifting needs.

2 - Organizational Memory:

  1. A system that maintains organizational memory to ensure that decisions, processes, and historical context aren't lost despite personnel changes or a decentralized nature.

3 - Permission Management:

  1. Vital due to its decentralized nature; ensuring only authorized individuals can access certain data.

4 - Transparency, Accountability, and Evaluation:

  1. Open processes in funding, hiring, and evaluations.
  2. Distinct criteria for gauging success at both macro and micro levels.

5 - Incentives and Contribution Management:

  1. Clear mechanisms for rewarding both specialized and broad contributions.
  2. Versatile reward structures that consider varying involvement levels.

6 - Financial Management:

  1. Proficient handling of finances, be it crypto or traditional.
  2. Ensuring compliance and safeguarding transactions.

7 - Governance and Decision-making:

  1. Melding decentralization with efficacy, blending DAO elements with traditional hierarchies for balanced innovation and control.
  2. Prioritizing stakeholder input in major decisions while upholding operational agility.

8 - Integration of Tools:

  1. Cohesive use of Web3 platforms.
  2. Minimizing redundancy through integrated tools.

Many of these components are incorporated in our offerings at Lomads. Dive into our live features and our roadmap.

Should you have insights or a pressing feature request, we're all ears.

At present, Lomads is operational on Ethereum, Polygon, Gnosis, Base, and Celo. Our presence will soon expand to Optimism, Arbitrum, and Avalanche. If you're crafting a tool and sense a collaborative opportunity, let's chat.

Give Lomads a try! Let's ensure the cannonball hits its mark.

title: Decentralizing Science: Bridging Gaps with Blockchain
subtitle: The world of science finds itself at an intriguing intersection. Even with mind-blowing advancements around every corner, we're still wrestling with issues like reproducibility, credibility, and just how well our scientific foundation holds up. And from this springs a bigger question: how can we shuffle our cards right to bridge the gap between core research and real-world benefits?
content:
Blockchain's Game-Changing Potential

Step into the world of blockchain, celebrated for its decentralized and transparent nature. This bad boy has the potential to completely redefine the science game. Picture this: a world where scientists can:

  1. Safely gather funds.
  2. Team up for experiments.
  3. Share data without a fuss.
  4. Lay out their findings for all to see.

Decentralized Science (DeSci) is on this wavelength, crafting a platform where researchers spill the beans on their projects, get the applause they deserve, and have an engaged audience cheering them on.

Pivotal Concerns in Scientific Research

Let's delve into some primary issues in scientific research and discern how blockchain is paving the way for solutions.

1. Balancing Supply and Demand

There's this yawning gap between what research can do and what the world really needs. While some researchers scratch their heads over what to tackle next, industries often miss out on golden solutions staring them in the face. Take a McKinsey study, for example, that zoomed in on the disconnect between pharma/biotech VC investments and global health needs.

Now, here's where things get spicy. IP-NFTs and IP tokens, brought to the table by Molecule, are shaking things up. These tools help in pooling money for IP growth, dishing out royalties, and opening the door to IP-protected goodies. This approach gets funds rolling in fast and lets the community call the shots over research IPs.

In early September, AthenaDAO, an upcoming project focused on women's health research, managed to scoop up 317K USDC via their $ATH token sale.

2. Revitalizing Publishing / Scientific Data Sharing

Let's delve into some primary issues in scientific research and discern how blockchain is paving the way for solutions.

The age-old research publishing system needs a facelift. Alongside the usual papers, it's high time we cheered on the sharing of raw data, clickable results, and the nitty-gritty behind methods.

Give a nod to initiatives like ResearchHub. Think of it as a social network on steroids for scientists, where sharing scholarly content doesn't just earn nods of approval but tangible rewards. They're cooking up tools to amp up researcher teamwork, content swapping, and good old peer feedback. In June, they bagged $5 million to help scientists turn their research into gold.

Next, we have ScieNFT. Using the versatility of NFTs, this innovative web3 platform allows scientists to convert their publications and data into traceable digital assets. The transparency and permanence offered by NFTs make them an ideal medium for online scientific sharing.

Lastly, there's LabDAO, an online collective dedicated to life science research. They provide open tools and infrastructure for computational studies and have recently introduced 'Records'â€”NFTs that chronicle scientific endeavors in detail. Each interaction on their Lab Exchange yields a new Record, a testament to continuous research progress.

3. Ensuring Fair Value Distribution

Science and Intellectual Property (IP) are getting a snazzy makeover. It's not just the VIPs calling the shots anymore; even the average Joe and Jane are getting in on the action.

In this dynamic, patients aren't mere bystanders. They're earning IP credits for their data donations, so they're not just fueling the research engine but also enjoying the ride.

Then there are the underdog investors. Once overshadowed, they're now in the limelight, with their insights and cash-steering medical innovations to really hit home.

Take HairDAO as an example. More than just a research initiative, it's a shining model of communal IP ownership. With a spotlight on tackling hair loss, HairDAO ensures that contributors don't just give but get backâ€”be it potential solutions or a slice of the IP treasure. It's all about joining forces and reaping the shared rewards.

4. Overcoming Research Indifference

Sometimes, research doesn't get the drumroll it deserves. Be it old-school thinking or vested interests, groundbreaking discoveries can get the cold shoulder. It's essential to champion a space where every piece of research, no matter its current buzz, gets its moment in the sun.

AsteriskDAO is addressing a pivotal concern. Consider this: women constitute half the global population, yet their health concerns frequently end up underrepresented, akin to a mere footnote in the vast tome of medical research. AsteriskDAO is determined to change this narrative.

Then, let's chat about brain health. Diseases where nerve cells go haywire, like Alzheimer's and Parkinson's, are not only brutal but often take a backseat in the funding race. Cerebrum DAO wants to change the game. They're all in for finding solutions faster and keeping our brains in tip-top shape because, let's be honest, brain health is a massive deal.

Summing Up

The future leans heavily on the authenticity and caliber of today's research. By reshuffling incentives, leveraging technologies like blockchain, and jazzing up the research ambiance, we're laying the groundwork for a more insightful and impactful tomorrow. Data from Inflection, a top-tier VC firm in the game, captures the momentum: over 95 DeSci projects (breaking down as 40% IP funding, 25% tools and data, 25% publishing, and 10% other) have raised a whopping $65 million in funding, with a talent force of 150+ full-time contributors.

With evidence like 9 IP-NFTs in circulation and approximately 2,400 users engaging with DeSci Products, the momentum is palpable.

Here's to shaping the bright and buzzing future of DeSci!

title: How to contribute to Decentralised Science (DeSci) Web3 collectives
subtitle: Decentralised Science (DeSci) is revolutionizing the way scientific research is conducted, and you have the opportunity to be a part of it. By joining Web3 collectives, you can contribute to this decentralised movement and propel scientific innovation forward
content:
In this article, we will explore the concept of DeSci, understand its principles, and discover the role Web3 plays in this exciting field. We will also discuss the importance of contributing to DeSci Web3 collectives, the necessary skills and knowledge required, and the steps to effectively contribute. Finally, we will address the challenges you may face and provide tips for overcoming them. So, let's dive in and learn how you can make a difference in the world of Decentralised Science.

Understanding the concept of Decentralised Science (DeSci)

Decentralised Science, or DeSci, is a paradigm shift in scientific research that aims to empower individuals and communities by removing traditional gatekeepers. In this exciting new approach, scientific knowledge is no longer confined to the ivory towers of academia or the closed circles of established institutions. Instead, DeSci promotes openness, collaboration, and transparency in the scientific process, making it accessible to all, regardless of geographical boundaries or institutional affiliations.

Imagine a world where groundbreaking discoveries are not limited to a select few, but are shared openly with the global community. With DeSci, this vision becomes a reality. By leveraging the power of blockchain technology and smart contracts, DeSci creates a decentralized network of contributors who collectively drive scientific progress. This network acts as a catalyst for innovation, breaking down barriers and fostering collaboration on a scale never seen before.

But what are the principles that underpin this revolutionary approach to science?

The principles behind DeSci

At the core of DeSci lie three fundamental principles:

  1. Openness: DeSci embraces openness by facilitating the sharing of research methods, data, and findings. Gone are the days of hoarding knowledge behind paywalls or jealously guarding research for personal gain. Instead, DeSci encourages scientists to openly share their work, inviting collaboration and fostering scientific breakthroughs. By removing the barriers to access, DeSci empowers researchers from diverse backgrounds to contribute their unique perspectives and expertise, enriching the scientific community as a whole.
  2. Transparency: Transparency is crucial in DeSci. In traditional scientific research, the process leading to a published paper can often be shrouded in mystery, with little visibility into the decision-making and validation processes. DeSci changes this by storing all contributions, transactions, and decisions on the blockchain. This ensures an immutable and auditable record of scientific progress, where every step is transparent and traceable. By making the scientific process more transparent, DeSci enhances trust and accountability, paving the way for more robust and reliable research outcomes.
  3. Community-driven: DeSci relies on the collective wisdom and diverse expertise of its contributors. In this decentralized ecosystem, every member has a voice and their input is valued. By fostering a community-driven approach, DeSci encourages active participation and collaboration. It recognizes that scientific progress is not the result of isolated efforts, but a collective endeavor. Through vibrant discussions, peer reviews, and collaborative projects, DeSci harnesses the power of the crowd, enabling scientists to collectively push the boundaries of knowledge.

Now that we understand the principles behind DeSci, let's explore the role of Web3 in this transformative movement.

The role of Web3 in DeSci

Web3, also known as the decentralized web, is the technological backbone of DeSci. It provides the infrastructure and tools necessary to realize the vision of a decentralized scientific research ecosystem. By leveraging blockchain, smart contracts, and decentralized storage, Web3 offers security, immutability, and trust in the scientific research process.

In the traditional scientific research landscape, intermediaries such as publishers, funding agencies, and academic institutions play a significant role in controlling access to knowledge. Web3 disrupts this centralized model by enabling direct peer-to-peer interactions. It eliminates the need for intermediaries, allowing researchers to interact and collaborate directly with each other, irrespective of their institutional affiliations.

One of the key advantages of Web3 is its ability to ensure the integrity and immutability of scientific contributions. By storing all transactions and decisions on the blockchain, Web3 creates an immutable record of scientific progress. This not only enhances transparency but also provides a reliable and auditable trail of the research process. Researchers can have confidence that their work will be preserved and accessible for future generations.

Furthermore, Web3 brings financial incentives to the table through the use of cryptocurrencies. By utilizing blockchain-based tokens, DeSci rewards contributors for their efforts. This incentivization model not only promotes active participation but also enables researchers to be recognized and rewarded for their valuable contributions to the scientific community.

With Web3 as its backbone, DeSci revolutionizes the way scientific research is conducted. It empowers individuals, fosters collaboration, and creates a more inclusive and equitable scientific ecosystem. By embracing openness, transparency, and community-driven approaches, DeSci paves the way for a future where scientific knowledge is truly accessible to all.

The importance of contributing to DeSci Web3 collectives

Contributing to DeSci Web3 collectives has far-reaching benefits, both for individuals and society as a whole.

Fostering scientific innovation through decentralisation

DeSci Web3 collectives empower scientists, researchers, and enthusiasts from diverse backgrounds to collaborate on projects that drive scientific innovation. By removing the barriers imposed by traditional research institutions, DeSci encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, leading to groundbreaking discoveries.

The impact of collective contributions on DeSci

Every contribution to a DeSci Web3 collective contributes to the collective intelligence of the entire community, fueling the progress of scientific research. All contributions, whether big or small, add value and expand the pool of scientific knowledge. Together, these contributions pave the way for future breakthroughs and advance humanity's understanding of the world.

Preparing to contribute to DeSci Web3 collectives

Before diving into the world of DeSci Web3 collectives, it's essential to equip yourself with the necessary skills and knowledge.

Necessary skills and knowledge for contribution

To effectively contribute to DeSci, it is beneficial to have a solid foundation in your field of interest. This includes knowledge of research methodologies, data analysis, and scientific writing. Additionally, being familiar with blockchain technology, cryptocurrency, and smart contracts will give you an edge in navigating the technological aspects of DeSci.

Understanding the technical aspects of Web3

Web3 operates on a different technological infrastructure compared to traditional web applications. Familiarize yourself with blockchain, decentralized storage, and smart contract platforms such as Ethereum. This knowledge will enable you to understand and make the most of the unique features provided by Web3 platforms.

Steps to contribute to DeSci Web3 collectives

Now that you have the necessary skills and knowledge, let's explore the steps to begin your journey of contribution within DeSci Web3 collectives.

Identifying the right DeSci collective for you

There are numerous DeSci collectives out there, each with its own focus and goals. Find a collective that aligns with your interests, expertise, and values. Conduct thorough research to understand their ongoing projects, contribution mechanisms, and community dynamics. Engage with existing members to gain insights and make an informed decision.

Navigating the contribution process

Once you have identified the right DeSci collective, familiarize yourself with their contribution guidelines and processes. This may involve submitting proposals, participating in peer reviews, or collaborating on ongoing projects. Follow these guidelines diligently and actively engage with the community. Don't be afraid to ask questions or seek feedback to improve your contributions.

Overcoming challenges in contributing to DeSci Web3 collectives

While contributing to DeSci Web3 collectives can be immensely rewarding, it may come with its own set of challenges. Here, we address some common obstacles and offer tips to overcome them.

Addressing common obstacles in the contribution process

Contributing to DeSci Web3 collectives may require you to adapt to different technological platforms, learn new tools, and collaborate with diverse individuals. Embrace these challenges as opportunities for growth. Be open to acquiring new skills, seek support from the community, and leverage online resources to overcome any hurdles you may encounter.

Tips for effective contribution to DeSci Web3 collectives

To make the most out of your contributions, consider the following tips:

  • Engage actively: Actively participate in discussions, contribute your ideas and expertise, and provide constructive feedback to fellow contributors.
  • Build relationships: Foster connections within the DeSci community. Collaborate with others, seek mentorship, and forge partnerships to enhance the impact of your contributions.
  • Stay updated: Keep yourself updated with the latest advancements in your field of interest, emerging technologies, and the evolving landscape of DeSci. This will help you contribute effectively and stay at the forefront of scientific innovation.
  • Embrace continuous learning: Science is constantly evolving, and so should your knowledge. Commit to continuous learning, explore new areas of research, and seek opportunities to expand your expertise.

By embracing these tips and overcoming challenges along the way, you are well on your path to becoming a valuable contributor to DeSci Web3 collectives.

So, what are you waiting for? Join the Decentralised Science (DeSci) revolution and start contributing to Web3 collectives. Together, we can shape the future of scientific research and drive innovation to new heights.

title: What is decentralised science (DeSci) in Web3?
subtitle: Decentralised science, commonly referred to as DeSci, is an innovative approach to scientific research that leverages the power of Web3 technology. In this article, we will explore the concept of DeSci, its connection to Web3, its potential impact on scientific research, and the challenges it faces.
content:
Understanding the concept of decentralised science

At its core, decentralised science aims to democratise and elevate the scientific research process by leveraging the principles of decentralisation, transparency, and open collaboration. Unlike traditional science, which often operates within closed systems and relies on centralised institutions, DeSci seeks to unleash the potential of the global scientific community by enabling anyone to participate in research.

One of the key principles of DeSci is the idea of open access, which ensures that scientific knowledge and data are freely available to all. This facilitates collaboration, accelerates the pace of discovery, and empowers researchers from diverse backgrounds to contribute their expertise.

Decentralised science operates on several core principles:

  1. Openness: DeSci promotes transparency and encourages the sharing of findings, methods, and data.
  2. Interdisciplinarity: DeSci encourages collaboration across different scientific disciplines, fostering diverse perspectives and innovative approaches.
  3. Meritocracy: DeSci aims to create a level playing field, where recognition and funding are based on the quality of research rather than institutional affiliations.
  4. Community-driven governance: DeSci promotes community-led decision-making processes to ensure inclusiveness and collective ownership.

Openness is a fundamental principle of decentralised science. By promoting transparency and encouraging the sharing of findings, methods, and data, DeSci fosters an environment of collaboration and trust. Researchers are no longer confined to working within closed systems, but instead, they have the opportunity to contribute to a global scientific community.

Interdisciplinarity is another key principle of DeSci. By encouraging collaboration across different scientific disciplines, DeSci fosters diverse perspectives and innovative approaches. This cross-pollination of ideas and expertise can lead to groundbreaking discoveries and advancements in various fields.

Meritocracy is a core value of decentralised science. In traditional science, recognition and funding often depend on institutional affiliations and hierarchies. However, DeSci aims to create a level playing field, where the quality of research takes precedence over institutional biases. This empowers researchers from all backgrounds to contribute their expertise and be recognised for their contributions.

Community-driven governance is a unique aspect of decentralised science. By promoting community-led decision-making processes, DeSci ensures inclusiveness and collective ownership. This means that the scientific community has a say in shaping the direction of research and the allocation of resources, fostering a sense of ownership and responsibility.

While traditional science has made remarkable contributions to human knowledge, it's not without limitations. DeSci offers several distinct advantages:

  • Removal of barriers: DeSci removes geographical, financial, and institutional barriers, making scientific research accessible and inclusive. Researchers no longer need to be affiliated with prestigious institutions or have access to extensive funding to contribute to the scientific community.
  • Enhanced collaboration: DeSci fosters collaboration among researchers from across the globe, leading to the pooling of expertise and resources. This global network of scientists can work together to tackle complex problems and accelerate the pace of scientific discovery.
  • Efficient data sharing: DeSci leverages Web3 technology to enable secure and efficient sharing of research data, expediting scientific progress. Researchers can easily access and build upon existing datasets, leading to more robust and comprehensive research outcomes.
  • Increased reproducibility: DeSci promotes the use of transparent and well-documented methods, increasing the reproducibility of scientific findings. This ensures that research outcomes can be independently verified and validated, enhancing the credibility and reliability of scientific knowledge.

Decentralised science is revolutionising the way scientific research is conducted. By embracing the principles of decentralisation, transparency, and open collaboration, DeSci empowers researchers from all backgrounds to contribute their expertise and accelerates the pace of scientific discovery. With its removal of barriers, enhanced collaboration, efficient data sharing, and increased reproducibility, decentralised science has the potential to transform the scientific landscape and unlock new frontiers of knowledge.

The role of Web3 in decentralised science

Web3, also known as the decentralized web, serves as the technological backbone supporting DeSci. It incorporates several key elements that enable the decentralisation of scientific research.

The connection between Web3 and DeSci

Web3 decentralises various aspects of DeSci, such as data storage, authentication, and collaboration. Through blockchain technology, Web3 ensures secure and tamper-proof data recording, fostering trust among researchers. Smart contracts enable automated and transparent transactions, facilitating funding and incentive mechanisms within the scientific community.

The benefits of using Web3 for DeSci

By integrating Web3 technology into DeSci, numerous benefits emerge:

  • Improved data privacy: Web3 provides robust encryption mechanisms, safeguarding sensitive research data.
  • Reduced reliance on intermediaries: Web3 eliminates the need for centralised intermediaries, streamlining research processes.
  • Enhanced data integrity: The immutability of blockchain ensures the integrity of research findings and data.
  • Efficient peer review: Web3 facilitates transparent and decentralised peer review systems, enhancing the quality of scientific publications.

The potential impact of DeSci on scientific research

The adoption of DeSci has the potential to revolutionise several aspects of scientific research, including data sharing and peer review processes.

How DeSci could change data sharing

DeSci introduces a paradigm shift in data sharing by emphasising open access and decentralised storage. This enables researchers to access a vast array of shared data, fostering collaborations and catalysing discoveries that would have been otherwise unattainable.

Moreover, researchers can trust the integrity of the data as it is stored and recorded on the blockchain, mitigating concerns of data manipulation or fraudulent practices. This secure and transparent data sharing framework contributes to a more robust scientific ecosystem.

The implications of DeSci for peer review

Peer review, the cornerstone of scientific quality assessment, undergoes transformation in the DeSci paradigm. By leveraging Web3 technology, the peer review process becomes more transparent, efficient, and decentralised.

Researchers can opt for public peer reviews, enabling the scientific community to scrutinise and validate their work. This increased transparency minimises biases and enhances the reliability of research findings. Additionally, Web3 enables the creation of reputation-based systems, where researchers' contributions and expertise are evaluated and rewarded.

The challenges and criticisms of DeSci

While DeSci promises numerous benefits, it also faces challenges and criticism that must be addressed.

Ethical considerations in DeSci

DeSci raises ethical concerns regarding data privacy, consent, and potential misuse of research findings. Striking a balance between open access and protecting individuals' rights and interests requires careful consideration and the establishment of robust ethical frameworks.

Technical hurdles in implementing DeSci

Implementing DeSci on a large scale requires overcoming technical challenges such as scalability, interoperability, and user-friendly interfaces. Developing the necessary infrastructure and tools to support the decentralised scientific ecosystem poses both technical and logistical hurdles.

The future of DeSci in Web3

As DeSci gains traction, several emerging trends and predictions offer a glimpse into its future.

Emerging trends in DeSci

A significant emerging trend is the integration of artificial intelligence and machine learning in DeSci. These technologies can augment data analysis, automate research workflows, and facilitate the discovery of new patterns and insights.

Predictions for DeSci in the next decade

In the next decade, we can expect DeSci to reshape research funding models. Web3 technology enables novel funding mechanisms, such as tokenomics and crowdfunding, which empower researchers to secure funding directly from the community, bypassing traditional grant systems.

Furthermore, DeSci may redefine scientific publishing, moving towards open and decentralised platforms that ensure the accessibility, transparency, and quality of scientific publications.

In conclusion, decentralised science (DeSci) in Web3 represents a transformative shift in scientific research. By leveraging the principles of decentralisation and the power of Web3 technology, DeSci promises to democratise scientific discovery, enhance collaboration, and redefine the way we conduct and disseminate research. Despite challenges, the future looks bright for DeSci, with emerging trends and innovative solutions paving the way for a more inclusive and transparent scientific landscape.

Author: Salome Bernhart

In the current era of digital advancements, data collection holds significant importance for users, connecting the virtual realm to the real world. As we interact with platforms like Google, ChatGPT and various other social media networks on a daily basis, we often provide our data and engage in activities without retaining control or ownership over the information generated. This practice raises critical questions about the value and implications of our personal data and interactions.

Data collection not only shapes the digital landscape but also influences the services and content we encounter. Platforms analyze user behaviour, preferences, and trends to deliver personalized experiences, targeted advertisements, and relevant recommendations. However, this exchange often disadvantages users, as they relinquish their data without adequate control or compensation.

Tipping the Data Scales

People often hand over their data to companies without receiving equal value, tipping the balance in favor of the platform. This denies users control over their data, triggering concerns about privacy, security, and ethical data use.

Privacy is paramount. Users demand secure data handling but without control, theyâ€™re in the dark about its collection and use. This opacity can result in privacy breaches, unsolicited data sharing, and misuse, exposing users to identity theft and intrusive ads. For instance, the 2021 LinkedIn debacle revealed the personal data of 700 million users.

Security intertwines with privacy. Platformsâ€™ inability to safeguard user data from breaches and cyberattacks is concerning. These breaches, unfortunately frequent, put user data in jeopardy. The 2022 average data breach cost skyrocketed to $4.35 million, further deepening the data contribution imbalance due to usersâ€™ limited recourse.

The advent of blockchain technology, smart contracts, Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs), and Soulbound Tokens (SBTs) presents an opportunity to revolutionize data handling. By emphasizing user control and data ownership, we can instil trust and inspire innovation in the digital landscape.

User Power in the Data Playground

Recognizing the significance of data ownership and control, emerging standards like EIP-6551 and ERC-5173 in the Ethereum ecosystem and new privacy-focused L2 blockchains, promote principles such as data composability, portability and privacy. These standards aim to empower users by offering frameworks that enhance their control and participation in data-related activities.

Data composability refers to the ability to combine and utilize data from various sources in a cohesive manner. It allows users to leverage their data across different platforms and services, enabling a more interconnected and personalized digital experience. By embracing data composability, users can harness the full potential of their data, creating synergies between different applications and unlocking new possibilities.

Similarly, data portability emphasizes usersâ€™ right to access and transfer their data between different platforms and services. It enables individuals to maintain ownership and control over their personal information, promoting transparency and empowering users to decide how their data is utilized. Data portability enables seamless transitions between platforms, reducing vendor lock-in and fostering a more user-centric approach.

ERC-6551 NFTs enable transactions, dApp interactions, token holding, and more

ERC-6551 is a new standard that improves the capabilities of NFTs on the Ethereum blockchain. It overcomes the limitations of the previous standard, ERC-721, which restricted NFTs from interacting with smart contracts, owning additional assets, and adapting to changing needs. By introducing ERC-6551, Ethereum expands the possibilities for NFTs and enables them to be used in new and exciting ways.

With the deployment of the Ethereum Improvement Proposal 6551 (EIP-6551) on May 7, 2023, ERC-6551 introduces a concept called Token-Bound Accounts (TBAs). Meaning each ERC-721 token can now have its own smart contract wallet, which allows NFTs to perform transactions, interact with decentralized applications, hold other tokens or NFTs, and even establish their on-chain identity.

The adoption of ERC-6551 significantly expands the functionality of NFTs, making them more versatile and valuable. NFTs with ERC-6551 can now engage in transactions, collaborate with various programs, hold a diverse range of assets, and even serve as unique identifiers on the blockchain. ERC-6551 can transform into a non-custodial comprehensive wallet that gives the individual complete ownership, transaction tracking, and utility records.

In a recent article, NFT Composability Expert Rob Secord highlights the drawbacks associated with ERC-6551 technology. One concern is the manipulation of upgradeable NFT contracts, which allows the contract owner to gain ownership of all NFTs and withdraw their assets. Another risk is the absence of proper time locks, enabling assets to be drained from an NFT just before a sale, resulting in an empty NFT for the buyer. To mitigate these risks, thorough security audits are necessary during the implementation of ERC-6551. Additionally, the lack of standardization and multiple implementations make it challenging for users to understand the features and capabilities of different â€œSmart Walletsâ€ linked to their NFTs. Therefore, developers and users must be vigilant about these risks, take necessary precautions, and prioritize security to safeguard against potential exploits.

Lomads, is actively exploring ERC-6551 to implement NFT wallet solution that further enhances the user experience of the platform. Recognizing the potential risks involved, Lomads is committed to implementing appropriate measures to mitigate any issues related to upgradeable NFT contracts and asset draining.

EIP-5173 NFTs offer ongoing profit potential to past owners, even after selling their tokens

EIP-5173 is a multigenerational reward mechanism that can reward previous NFTs owners. It proposes a profit-sharing framework called nFR for EIP-721 tokens (NFTs) on the Ethereum blockchain. This framework allows previous NFT owners to benefit from future price increases even after selling their tokens. By introducing a giving circle concept, participants collaborate to build greater wealth through each otherâ€™s success. The FR implementation ensures that both buyers and sellers receive future rewards, fostering a fair and mutually beneficial economic rule.

The motivation behind this proposal is to address unfair trading practices and create a more equitable system for all market participants. In traditional trading, average traders often face challenges due to asymmetry of information and techniques employed by various actors, leading to losses by the majority of traders.

The nFR framework aims to level the playing field by establishing a giving circle where participants contribute to each otherâ€™s success. Through this framework, NFT owners can participate in a gift-economy model, similar to the open-source spirit, fostering community interdependence and shared benefits.

The nFR proposal sets a standard interface for profit sharing throughout the tokenâ€™s ownership history. It incentivizes traders to actively engage in the tokenâ€™s price discovery process. By tracking transactions and recording price changes, the nFR framework aims to ensure that the value of NFTs reflects the contributions made by their owners.

This transparent approach discourages unfair practices and encourages transparency and fairness. It is important to note that the nFR framework is not a Ponzi scheme, as it distributes profits only when they are achieved, and future return shares depend on actual profits made by subsequent token holders. By embracing EIP-5173, NFTs become more than collectibles, gaining an additional layer of value and promoting a collaborative and fair trading environment within the Ethereum ecosystem.

Lomads is thrilled about the potential of EIP-5173 and will soon start working towards offering its customers the option to launch and utilize these NFTs in the upcoming months.

Pathway to making web3 more inclusive to a wide spectrum of users

Introduction

The world of blockchain technology is constantly evolving, and one concept that has been gaining significant attention is â€˜account abstractionâ€™.

This paradigm shift allows for programmable blockchain accounts, where smart contracts exclusively hold assets, removing the need for externally-owned accounts (EOAs) to initiate and control transactions on behalf of users.

Account abstraction opens up a realm of possibilities, empowering developers to create sophisticated wallets and innovative transactions.

Letâ€™s delve into the exciting use cases of account abstraction and discover how Lomads stands to benefit from this transformative approach.

Unlocking the Potential of Account Abstraction

Account abstraction introduces numerous use cases that revolutionize the way we interact with blockchain systems. Letâ€™s explore some of the key features:

Use cases of Account Abstraction

Most of the use cases presented above can be implemented right-away, thanks to services such as Biconomy and Web3Auth, two of Lomadsâ€™ partners. Several account abstraction features such as option for social login and gasless transactions are already implemented in Lomads and we are confident that it is going to find wide-spread use.

A case in point, Visa, the worldâ€™s second-largest card payment organization, has released a technical paper discussing the need for improved user experiences and functionality in blockchain-based products. They propose a solution using Account Abstraction, a concept from Ethereum, to enable automated programmable payments. The paper highlights the challenge of setting up recurring payments on a blockchain and introduces the idea of delegable accounts, which allow users to delegate payment instructions to a pre-approved smart contract. It also mentions the implementation of Account Abstraction on StarkNet, a Layer 2 blockchain built on Ethereum. Visa sees auto payments as a crucial feature that the current blockchain infrastructure lacks and believes that programmable money and payments offer exciting opportunities.

Lomads Harnessing the Power of Account Abstraction

Lomads acknowledges the power of account abstraction and is proactively positioning itself to capitalize on this technology. Our strategy draws on two critical insights from over 100 observed organizations:

  1. As the market shifts from early adopters to early majority, we detect a desire for improved user experience and a resolution to the web2 versus web3 debate.
  2. In web3 organizations, a disconnect exists between forward-thinkers and the broader community, underlining the challenge of sustaining innovation that appeals to all users.

Embracing account abstraction, Lomads aims to deliver an unmatched, user-friendly experience to a diverse range of users. Hereâ€™s how:

  1. User-Friendly Onboarding: The technology simplifies the entry point into the blockchain by replacing complex cryptographic key management with familiar identifiers such as usernames or email addresses. This lowers the barrier for newcomers to the web3 ecosystem.
  2. Operational Ease: Account abstraction mitigates operational friction by facilitating gasless transactions. Whether conducting financial transactions, minting membership NFT/SBT, or deploying smart contracts, users can bypass the need for native coin balances. Thus, organizations can pre-pay gas fees, easing individual burden.
  3. Effortless Account Recovery: With the influx of new users, account recovery becomes essential. Account abstraction enables easy recovery via traditional methods like email-based resets and multi-factor authentication. And of course, there will be new web3 native methods that are yet to come!
  4. Enhanced Security: This technology safeguards user accounts and transactions by employing robust cryptographic techniques, reducing risks associated with user errors such as incorrect fund transfers due to typos.
  5. Interoperability and Collaboration: Account abstraction paves the way for seamless interaction across multiple dApps and platforms. It eliminates the need for separate accounts per application, simplifying collaboration and contributing to a vibrant web3 ecosystem.

As such, by harnessing the power of account abstraction, Lomads is leading the charge in creating a secure, accessible, and collaborative web3 environment, paving the way for a more inclusive and user-friendly future in the blockchain ecosystem.

Author: Salome Bernhart

The increasing legal scrutiny of DAOs highlights the importance of authentic decentralization. In the current environment, merely wrapping a DAO in one or more legal structures without achieving true decentralization can result in serious legal consequences. The distinction between a genuine DAO and a â€œfakeâ€ DAO, which only mimics decentralization, has become crucial for legal protection. However, current regulations do not provide clear guidance on how to make this distinction.

Compliance and long-term viability of a DAO involve dispersing decision-making authority and resource allocation among a wide range of participants. This not only bolsters the organizationâ€™s legitimacy, but also reduces the likelihood of legal issues arising, and in many cases improves Tokenomics.

DAOs must carefully consider the legal wrappers they choose. Legal structures can offer varying levels of protection and compliance depending on the jurisdiction in which they operate and the reason they are being used. Therefore, it is crucial that DAOs consult with legal experts to determine the most suitable legal wrappers for their specific circumstances. Regrettably, the majority of legal advisors tend to specialize in a single jurisdiction, while the inherent nature and reach of DAOs are global in scope. This presents a challenge in locating highly skilled legal professionals who possess not only a deep understanding of blockchain technology but also comprehensive expertise in international law.

A Shift in Legal Perspective

The legal landscape surrounding DAOs has shifted significantly over the past few years. MiCA regulation is currently a hot topic in the space, and itâ€™s crucial for web3 structures to understand its parameters. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) issued a discussion paper on crypto-assets and stablecoins, inviting views from the industry and public on the relevant regulatory approach. In the U.S. lawmakers have so far failed to get a comprehensive policy framework relating to crypto and digital assets passed, leading to what many are calling a â€œwarâ€ between the industry and regulators.

The Markets in Crypto-assets (MiCA) regulations are part of a comprehensive legislative proposal introduced by the European Commission to provide a harmonized regulatory framework for crypto-assets across the European Union (EU). The aim of the MiCA regulations is to promote innovation, protect investors, and maintain financial stability by addressing potential risks associated with the use and trading of digital assets.

The MiCA regulations cover a wide range of aspects related to crypto-assets, including their issuance, trading, and service provision. They establish clear definitions for different types of crypto-assets, such as asset-referenced tokens, electronic money tokens, and utility tokens, and outline specific requirements for each category. The framework also addresses aspects like anti-money laundering (AML), know-your-customer (KYC) procedures, and the licensing and supervision of crypto-asset service providers. Furthermore, it includes provisions related to stablecoins, with a particular emphasis on significant asset-referenced tokens and electronic money tokens, which may pose systemic risks.

In Europe, crypto projects must ensure compliance with GDPR and carefully assess their data collection, processing, and storage practices, and implement appropriate measures to protect personal data.

What about NFTs?

Lomads has just launched its awesome Membership Soulbound Token (SBT) machine. This nifty product module makes it super easy for organizations to sell membership SBTs, even to folks who donâ€™t have a wallet or crypto. These SBTs are a perfect fit for cases like alumni clubs or wellness clubs where the reputation or roles earned shouldnâ€™t be transferable to others. As we implemented this solution, the team made sure to dive into the legal implications of selling SBTs, which essentially function as NFTs.

The categorization of NFTs under the proposed MiCA legislation is currently unclear, leading to uncertainty for issuers and businesses involved in NFTs. While certain provisions imply that NFTs should be outside MiCAâ€™s scope, another provision suggests that if NFTs are part of a sizable series or collection, their non-fungible status could be questioned, possibly placing them under MiCA. This would subject NFT collection issuers to the same disclosure and compliance requirements intended for financial instrument issuers, and those building NFT collection marketplaces, custodians, or aggregators could be deemed MiCA crypto-asset service providers.

After all, it remains unclear whether a standard NFT profile-picture collection will be deemed to have been issued in a sizable series or collection by regulators. Moreover, this raises interesting questions regarding technology neutrality, particularly in instances where NFT collections represent tickets, in-game assets, audio or text files and digital autographs as they may be considered regulated financial instruments in the token form under MiCA, but not in their analogue or existing digital versions.

Prioritise innovation in a (todayâ€™s) legally compliant way

While Web3 prioritizes innovation and creativity, it cannot overlook the importance of operating legally. Companies will be hesitant to interact with Web3 projects that do not have a legal structure, and this limits DAOâ€™s growth potential.

Every DAO needs to decide how compliant they wish to be and which legal wrapper(s) would best serve their needs. While some DAOs may choose to remain regime-less, others may opt for a more traditional legal structure that enables them to bridge the gap between the virtual and physical worlds. See further sources here from a16z and from Paradigm.

Image 1: Legalnodes

In the pursuit of legal compliance, itâ€™s crucial not to impair membersâ€™ privacy, DAO-2-DAO integrations, growth, and innovation by adding legal friction points or bottlenecks. Any legal structure should not change the current relationship between the governance framework and its existing ecosystem, and should not create any impediments to the evolution of the protocol or add stress to the current governance model.

Having a legal framework provides a sense of security, can help attract more investment and facilitate partnerships, which in turn brings more safety and value to its contributors. Quality contributors are more likely to join Web3 structures with a clear legal framework, as it protects their interests, provides legal recourse in case of any disputes, and facilitates interaction with other companies and institutions.

In conclusion, by embracing transparency, accountability and a healthy dose of legal expertise, Web3 organizations can traverse the winding path toward financial sustainability with confidence. As we continue to innovate and push the boundaries of whatâ€™s possible in the crypto space, itâ€™s essential to remember the importance of enjoying the journey and celebrating our achievements along the way.

Author: Salome Bernhart

In the fast-paced world of blockchain and Web3 organizations, the crypto industry continuously evolves, and uncertainty is ever-present. This article explores the crucial nature of mission statements and organizational memory in Web3. We discuss the importance of a well-aligned communication system and the role of AI in aiding organizational memory.

The research that we have conducted shows that the importance of a well-defined and effectively communicated mission statement cannot be understated in Web3. The rapidly evolving landscape poses significant challenges to the success and sustainability of these organizations. A strong mission statement helps to establish the organizationâ€™s strategic direction and community values. Additionally, maintaining organizational memory is crucial for onboarding new members, ensuring that the organization can learn from past decisions and maintain a sense of continuity despite personnel changes.

The Role of Mission Statements in Web3 Organizations and DAOs

A well-defined mission statement serves as a guiding light, keeping stakeholders focused and steering the organization toward its core purpose. In the early stages of Web3 organizations, some degree of centralization is often necessary, as humans have always sought direction and leadership in their social structures, especially in times of experimentation and uncertainty. This leadership is crucial for communities to function effectively, especially in the initial stages of a project.

Effective Communication Strategies for Mission Statements

To avoid misinterpretations and conflicts, it is essential to effectively communicate the mission and ensure that all stakeholders are on the same page, during all different stages of development of the project. Some strategies for effective communication include:

  1. Keeping the mission statement simple and concise.
  2. Making the mission statement visible on various communication platforms.
  3. Including the mission statement during onboarding and reiterating the mission statement regularly.
  4. Encouraging open dialogue to clarify bottlenecks and friction points.

Organizational Memory in DAOs

Organizational memory refers to the need to retain and share information about the organizationâ€™s history, decisions, and processes. This information can be challenging to maintain in a DAO, where members come and go frequently, and decision-making is decentralized. Maintaining organizational memory is essential for the long-term success of a DAO, as it helps to ensure that the organization remains cohesive and effective over time.

AI Solutions for Maintaining Organizational Memory

As of today, DAOs are aware that keeping good documentation is crucial and now new tools have emerged to support these efforts. AI can be used to bridge information gaps and help members manage the DAOâ€™s organizational memory more effectively. Some potential AI use cases include:

  1. Knowledge graph: Maps out the organizationâ€™s history, decisions, and processes, helping members visualize the relationships between different pieces of information.
  2. Chatbot: Answers questions about the organizationâ€™s history, decisions, and processes, helping new members quickly get up to speed.
  3. Natural language processing system: Parses and categorizes information in the organizationâ€™s knowledge base, making it easier for members to search for and find relevant information.

Aligning Individual Contributions and Dispute Resolution

A clear mission statement helps align individual contributions with the organizationâ€™s overall objectives, encourages members to consider how their efforts support the mission and help identify areas where they can make a greater impact. Establishing a strong culture of collaboration and teamwork can ensure that everyoneâ€™s efforts are channeled toward the common goal. Implementing consensus-building frameworks that encourage respectful dialogue, mutual understanding, and compromise can help diffuse tensions and maintain harmony.

Pioneering Change â€” Harnessing AI and DAO Insights for a New Era of Management

The next generation of management tools must harness the potential of technologies, such as AI, and incorporate lessons learned from the pioneering DAOs to revolutionize organizational structures. By crafting a well-defined mission statement, these tools can guide projects towards a clear purpose that unifies and motivates team members. Furthermore, AI-driven communication strategies will streamline information sharing, promoting transparency and fostering collaboration across teams. To maximize efficiency and productivity, these advanced tools should align individual contributions with the organizationâ€™s overarching goals, tailoring tasks to match the skill sets and strengths of each member. Lastly, leveraging insights from DAOs, next-gen management tools should prioritize dispute resolution, fostering an inclusive environment that encourages diverse perspectives while equitably addressing conflicts within the community. This holistic approach to organizational management will pave the way for more agile, adaptive, and resilient enterprises in a rapidly evolving business landscape.

title: The One Size DAO Myth: How Project Needs Differ Based on Stage & Maturity
content:
Web3 Project Stages by Lomads

When it comes to how to best run a Web3 project or DAO (decentralized autonomous organization), many people think there is a one size fits all solution for growth and expansion.

However, this couldnâ€™t be further from the truth as DAOs have specific needs based on where they are in the development cycle. For example, a new organization with 5 members has vastly different priorities than a project with hundreds of contributors that has been around for multiple months.

In this article, we will go over how to differentiate the 4 stages of Web3 projects, identify the specific needs, and detail how Lomads can assist projects at every stage.

Project Stages & Main Issues Faced

The 4 major project stages are:

Stage 1 â€” Hatching: The earliest project stage, Hatchings often have a well-defined end goal, but little clarity about processes and long-term stability.

Stage 2 â€” Nestling: This stage consists of collectives and startups with strong workflows. Nestlings usually have received small funding and have some established processes, but lack clarity on long-term financial viability.

Stage 3 â€” Juvenile: Juvenile projects have an understanding of financial viability, and have established processes in place. Additionally, they have adequate funding or sources of revenue.

Stage 4 â€” Adult: As the final stage for projects, Adult projects are made up of paid contributors and team members. Their workflow is verified, their smart contracts are audited, and they have secure and growing sources of revenue. They also tend to become incubators for other projects and startups.

New projects face two major roadblocks when starting out: incorrectly identifying needs and prioritizing development steps.

When starting out, itâ€™s easy to look at the leading projects in the space and try to emulate them; however, this is actually harmful to the project.

This problem is only increased by many influencers and media outlets in Web3 who focus specifically on large projects; they tend to talk about DAOs in relation to the largest projects in the space instead of breaking them down by the stage.

By doing this, small and mid-sized organizations arenâ€™t factored in which leads many startups to misidentify needs and next steps.

The other main issue for organizations comes from how they prioritize development, specifically when it comes to decentralization. Since decentralization is the first letter in DAO, many assume it should be the focus of all projects.

This is misleading as if a project isnâ€™t organized or autonomous, then attempting to be decentralized will only lead to more problems. Instead, projects need to make organizing their processes and then automating them their primary objectives.

And this is exactly what Lomads can help with.

How Lomads Helps Early Stage Projects

Lomads first came to be by noticing this crucial blind spot in the Web3 and DAO space.

Lomads is geared towards Nestling stage projects; these projects have received initial funding, built a core team, and acquired contributors. Their main needs revolve around having efficient workflow tooling to organize and automate processes.

By using Lomadsâ€™ workflow automation, Nestling projects can organize their workspaces and tasks, automate treasury and payments management to save time and money, and set up processes to reward early contributors with future funding.

The importance of protecting user data & how Lomads ensures user security & encryption

Privacy & Encryption in Web3 by Lomads

When it comes to data in Web3, the importance of security and encryption cannot be understated.

In todayâ€™s world, collecting user data is common practice to create better user experience by providing personalized content and access to certain products and services. According to a consumer survey from Axway:

â€œâ€¦almost 60% of people believe itâ€™s worth allowing companies to access their personal data if it means a better user experience.â€

While this access to user data is crucial to providing an optimal and engaging user experience, there are downsides to collecting and storing user data. Namely when it comes to privacy, security, ethical, and legal considerations. This is especially true when it comes to Blockchains which by principle are completely transparent and public.

Any and all information stored on a blockchain is is open for anyone to have a look. So how can we ensure confidentiality of user data in Web3?

Optimal Encryption of User Data

Bridging security and anonymity is one of the major challenges in Web3. As Chainanalysis co-founder Jonathan Levin said:

â€œThe two extremes of total anonymity and complete transparency are bad. Complete anonymity opens the door to illicit activityâ€¦ On the other hand, complete transparency means no privacy at all.â€

At Lomads, user data storage and security is one of our top priorities; we aim to implement a security system that enables data owners access to their personal information to use and share at their own discretion to limit any openings for potential security risks.

For this purpose, we are using Public key cryptography, also known as asymmetric cryptography, to encrypt sensitive user data. An example of this is with Soulbound Token (SBT) Metadata, and the process is illustrated below:

Process of Asymmetric Cryptography

Asymmetric cryptography uses two different keys: the public key (available for anyone to use) and private key (known to the user only). Data encrypted with the public key can only be decrypted with the corresponding private key. This allows data to be encrypted before being inserted on the blockchain and ensures only the owner of the data can decrypt and access the data!

title: The Future of Utility NFTs in Web3

content:
How NFTs and Soulbound Tokens will grow and evolve in 2023 and beyond

Utility NFTs in Web3 by Lomads

The Rise and Fall of NFTs

NFTs, or non-fungible tokens, have taken the world by storm in the last few years with digital art being their main use.

However, with recent developments and occasional bear markets, a lot of people are wondering, â€œWhat is the future for NFTs in 2023?â€ In early May 2022, the Wall Street Journal published an article titled, â€œNFT sales are Flat-lining. Is this the beginning of the end?â€ They raised similar concerns to what function NFTs will have in the future:

So, does NFT have a future, or is it a passing fad? What are the potential NFT directions and trends we will see in 2023?

Through all of the questions and worry, NFTs as a technology are here to stay and their main function will be providing utility in Web3.

Utility NFTs

One of the key criticisms of NFTs has been the lack of practical usage.

This has given them a dodgy reputation and has made people doubt the perseverance of the NFT technology. Going forward users expect additional value and functionality from their NFTs which will guide how NFTs are valued.

This unique feature of adding utility to NFT projects is most likely going to thrive in 2023.

Projects are looking to use NFTs, not just as fun pictures you can use on social media, but as versatile and sustainable tokens in daily life. The added utility will increase the value of NFTs while at the same time increasing the usability of blockchain technology by exploring new ways to use NFTs in real life.

Depending on the project the utility of each NFT can be different.

We will see more and more NFT related projects in 2023 that will use NFTs as for utility and advantages as opposed to only having NFTs for digital art pieces. These advantages include:

  • access to physical world such as events or products or discounts
  • enter into agreements with others for goods and services
  • access to various apps and content such as gaming, usage of features

There are numerous examples of utility NFTs being used with Web3 and Metaverse organizations. GMI Hoodie combines both digital and physical ownership rights in one place. Users can buy physical hoodies that can be sacnned upon receipt to obtain both a NFT and $1 in GMI tokens. If an owners resells the hoodie, the NFT is transferred to the new owner to prove ownership.

Another great example is a project called RobotEra which bridges NFTs, Play-to-Earn gaming, and Metaverse in one platform. By owning a RobotEra NFT, users earn special benefits within the game.

Additionally, we have already seen real world cases of established, traditional companies building utility NFTs into their product offering. One of the most famous examples from 2022 is Alfa Romeo including a NFT with their Tonale SUV. This NFT records vehicle data to assure the car has been properly maintained to help provide transparency to the current and future car owners.

Examples like these will only continue to increase in 2023 as we are seeing Fortune 500 Companies, such as Starbucks, Disney, and Coca-Cola, expand to Web3.

Lomads & Utility NFTs

At Lomads, Utility NFTs are built into the core of our product offering in the form of Soulbound Tokens (SBT) which hold the key to automated permission less rights and access control.

Soulbound Token ownership along with the metadata stored in the SBT will unlock different utilities within the organizational ecosystem like:

  1. Access to 3rd party apps like Notion and Discord
  2. Access to Treasury Management Functions to:
  • Create transactions to distribute funds
  • Sign and Approve Transactions

3. Access to Operations related functions

  • Create Projects and Teams
  • Create and Review Tasks

Additionally, the utility of Lomads Soulbound Tokens will increase in the future. You can view the full information of our Soulbound Tokens here.

title: Lomads Partners with IPFS & Filecoin via Protocol Labs

content:
Why we chose IPFS & Filecoin & how this will benefit customers

Lomads Partnership Announcement with Filecoin & IPFS

Lomads is thrilled to announce our partnership with IPFS & Filecoin via Protocol Labs!

As industry leaders in data storage & encryption, we have integrated both to maximize user data privacy & security of off-chain data. This encryption and storage covers both customer data and Soulbound Token (SBT) metadata!

See below for more details on why we chose these technologies, why decentralized storage is important, and how you, the customer, will benefit from their implementation.

Centralized vs. Decentralized Storage

In today's data driven digital world the amount of data collected by social media media websites and internet browsers in mind boggling.

Sadly 90% of all web traffic data is centralized among top 5 companies and hence subject to their internal policies and rules. In Q2 of 2022, IDC (International Data Corporation) conducted a Cloud Storage Survey to better understand the drawbacks and limitations of the existing Web2-based cloud storage providers. The results were eye-opening:

Results of IDCâ€™s Cloud Storage Survey by IDC

With the vast issues centralized storage faces, decentralized storage has become the go-to solution for reliability, scalability, and security. As Daniel Norman, developer advocate at IPFS said,

Centralized storage is limited to a small number of providers, limiting pricing and efficiency, and very little interoperability, leading to consumer lock-inâ€¦storage is costly, and it is not always verifiable and immutable. This is why a decentralized, efficient, and robust foundation for storing information is needed.â€

Web3 proposes a new â€œdecentralizedâ€ model of data storage which promises to be more liberal and privacy-centric.

It aims to enable anyone to use digital services without having to reveal their personal data to companies that would monetize it, thereby putting control with the data owners.

The decentralized model transfers authority from a central power to a more localized and â€˜liberalâ€™ system by spreading the hosting of files i.e. storing data across multiple computers also known as nodes which are connected together on a peer-to-peer (P2P) network.

This helps in protecting the integrity, accessibility, and security of data. In addition to these positives, the cost of storage has proven to be beyond 95% lower on a per-gigabyte basis than todayâ€™s market rates for Web2-based public cloud storage providers (and can even be free in some cases).

Why IPFS & Filecoin?

We have chosen to use IPFS (InterPlanetary File System) & Filecoin via Protocol Labs, a leader in Web3 storage, to maximize Lomadsâ€™ decentralized data storage potential.

IPFS is a Protocol Labs project that has created a new way for storing and retrieving information on the web. Rather than using the traditional approach of location based addressing, (where is the data), IPFS uses content addressing (what is the data). This preserves the integrity of data and ensures long-term data persistence and immutability.

Filecoin is an incentive layer on top of IPFS; it works by rewarding nodes to keep data storage in perpetuity. By doing this, Filecoin has created a whole new economy around incentive based, decentralized storage through networking. Currently, Filecoin is able to reliably service over 1 billion weekly data retrieval calls.

With the dramatic improvements IPFS & Filecoin have in scalability, reliability, decentralization, and cost-reduction, they have solved many of the problems Web2 cloud storage faces all while creating a sustainable and profitable network.

Benefits for Customers

Lomads is using these technologies for off-chain data storage as we believe in privacy and security above all else.

IPFS & Filecoin gives us the ability to protect user data without compromising privacy and autonomy. Additionally, IPFS provides robust data backups to drastically reduce the chance of server failure and give customers peace of mind.

Specifically, we will be using IPFS to store the following organization data:

  • Projects and Tasks
  • Transactions (payments, salaries, transfers etc.)
  • Soulbound Token (SBT) Metadata

content:
How Soulbound Tokens (SBTs) work & will function in Lomads Dashboard

Soulbound Token Overview by Lomads

Soulbound Tokens (SBTs) have become extremely popular over the past few months, and will be integral in the next wave of Web3, Crypto, & NFTs.

However, there is still a lot of confusion as to how SBTs will function in both real-world and blockchain ecosystems. In this article, we go through what utilities SBTs can have, and how they will function in Lomads Dashboard to create an optimal and secure user experience.

What are Soulbound Tokens?

Soulbound Tokens are non-transferable digital tokens that represent an immutable identity on the blockchain.

They canâ€™t be bought or sold and are most commonly used to provide certifications, symbolize an accomplishment, or build reputations. Proposed examples of how to use SBTs include managing medical records, certifying educational degrees, and verifying job history or professional qualifications.

Within the realm of Web3, there are many more proposed use cases for SBTs including DAO membership and anonymous identity verification.

How will Lomads Dashboard use Soulbound Tokens?

Lomads will implement SBTs for 3 major functions:

  1. Single access token across 3rd party tools
  2. Personalized dashboard & data ownership
  3. Immutable record of contributions

Single Access Token Across 3rd Party Tools

Using Lomads, you can roll our SBTs into your organization without having to write a single line of code!

Your SBT will serve as an access token to 3rd party tools, such as Notion & Discord, and allow for maximized interoperability.

Personalized Dashboard & Data Ownership

Each organization will have their own SBTs for their respective members.

This will allow for easy permission & task assignments, and allows every member to retain ownership of his/her own personal data.

Immutable Record of Contributions

Each organizationâ€™s SBT will record what contributions each member is making towards a project.

This not only improves transparency, but build membersâ€™ accountability and credibility over time.

The addition of Soulbound Tokens in Lomads Dashboard will not only allow for optimal user experience and permissions management, but also allows for secure and efficient storage of metadata.

Lomads & Safe Partnership by Lomads

Safe has become a household name for digital asset management and is the market leader for multi-signature wallet solutions.

They provide a non-custodial infrastructure for DAOs and Web3 Organizations to effectively manage treasuries without single points of failure by aiming to solve the issue of private keys being the single point of failure. Safeâ€™s multi-signature feature provides DAOs and Organizations an additional security layer to safely deploy funds by ensuring that multiple stakeholders sign off on a transaction before funds are released.

Safe also built a reputation as one of the most trusted and efficient asset management platforms in Web3; to date Safe has processed over 2,600,000 transactions, and holds +$31 billion on ERC20 tokens across +850K Safes!
